title: Hillsboro Municipal Airport (Illinois)
text:
Hillsboro Municipal Airport was a city-owned, public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located two <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (4 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) southeast of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Hillsboro%2C%20Illinois">Hillsboro</a>, a city in <a href="Montgomery%20County%2C%20Illinois">Montgomery County</a>, <a href="Illinois">Illinois</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>.
Facilities and aircraft.
Hillsboro Municipal Airport covered an area of 30 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (12 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 637 feet (194 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It had one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 18/36 with a <a href="grass">turf</a> surface measuring 4,150 by 200 feet (1,265 x 61 m).
For the 12-month period ending October 31, 2005, the airport had 3,000 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 250 per month. At that time there were 8 aircraft based at this airport, all single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a>.
In 2008, the airport was closed and the ground leased to a local coal mining operation.
